verses.text: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
And \add the things\add* that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.
Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
No \add man\add* that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of \add this\add* life; that he may please him who hath chosen \add him\add* to be a soldier.
And if a man also strive for masteries, \add yet\add* is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.
The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.
Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all \add things\add*.
Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David \add was\add* raised from the dead according to my gospel:
wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, \add even\add* unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.
Therefore I endure all \add things\add* for the elects’ sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
\add It is\add* a faithful saying: For if we be dead with \add him\add*, we shall also live with \add him:\add*
if we suffer, we shall also reign with \add him:\add* if we deny \add him\add*, he also will deny us:
if we believe not, \add yet\add* he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.

Of these \add things\add* put \add them\add* in remembrance, charging \add them\add* before the Lord that \add they\add* strive not about words to no profit, \add but\add* to the subverting of the hearers.
Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
But shun profane \add and\add* vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.
And their word will eat as \add doth\add* a canker: of whom is Hymeneus and Philetus;
who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.
Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.
But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.
If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master’s use, \add and\add* prepared unto every good work.
Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.
And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all \add men\add*, apt to teach, patient,
in meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;
and \add that\add* they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, \add who are\add* taken captive by him at his will.
